133.question: How To Cite a Poem Using APA Style
133.gt: If you want to cite a poem using the APA style, include your quote from a poem in quotation marks if it's less than 40 words, and use forward slashes to indicate line breaks. To cite a longer passage, begin the quote on a new line and indent it to create a block quotation. For your in-text citation, include the author's name, year of publication, and page number, preceded by the letter "p." When it comes to the title, capitalize all major words, place short titles in quotes, and italicize longer titles.
133.pred: To cite a poem using APA style, you would follow the format: Author's Last Name, First Initial. (Year of Publication). Title of Poem. In Title of Book. Publisher. For example, if you were citing a poem from a book, you would include the author's last name, first initial, the year of publication, the title of the poem, the title of the book, and the publisher.

262.question: How To Make a Chore Chart
262.gt: To make a chore chart, start by writing out a list of chores that need to be done in your household on a weekly basis. Next, divide the tasks among the members of your household, taking account of each person’s abilities and schedules. Then, draw a chart on a dry erase board with eight columns and as many rows as you have chores. In the first column, list each chore, and on the top row, list each day of the week. Finally, have each person put a check mark in the correct spot with a marker in their assigned color each time they finish a chore.
262.pred: To make a chore chart, you will need a piece of paper and a pen. First, draw a chart with the names of the family members on the left side and the chores on the right side. Next, draw a line down the middle of the chart and write the days of the week on the left side. Then, draw a line down the middle of the chart and write the days of the week on the right side. Finally, draw a line down the middle of the chart and write the days of the week on the right side.

265.question: How To Make Time for Yourself
265.gt: To make time for yourself, try waking up a little earlier in the morning so you have time to do things before your day starts. If you're really busy because of work, chores, or errands, see if you can delegate some of those tasks to someone else, like a family member or coworker. Also, try to limit your use of electronics since watching TV and scrolling on your phone can take up a lot of your spare time. Instead, schedule an hour or more every evening to focus on doing things you enjoy, like your hobbies.
265.pred: To make time for yourself, you can start by writing down your daily and weekly activities and identifying the ones that are not necessary or do not bring you fulfillment. Then, eliminate those activities and replace them with more productive or enjoyable ones. For example, if you spend a lot of time watching TV shows that do not provide any value, you can replace that time with activities such as going to the gym, taking a class, or doing more revision. By doing this, you can free up more time in your day to focus on things that are important to you and bring you fulfillment.

290.question: How To Save Time
290.gt: To save time, try working on similar tasks in batches to help you work more efficiently. For example, set aside large chunks of time twice a day to reply to e-mails, or prepare all your meals for the week on Sunday afternoons. Additionally, delegate tasks to other people, like asking a co-worker to lead a meeting or having a family member be responsible for doing the dishes. You should also avoid things that can distract you, such as social media apps on your phone or having the TV on while you work.
290.pred: To save time, you can prepare the dough in advance and let it rest in the refrigerator for a few hours or overnight. This will allow the yeast to activate and the dough to rise, saving you time in the long run.

292.question: How To Stay Neat, Clean, and Organized (Teenagers)
292.gt: To keep yourself neat and clean, try to set a daily personal care routine for yourself. Make sure you take a shower every day, or at least every other day. When you hop in the shower, remember to scrub your hair and keep it nice and clean. Try to get in the habit of brushing your teeth at least twice a day - once in the morning, and once in the evening. You might also want to learn how to do your own laundry, so you always have a fresh, clean outfit to wear - ask your parents to teach you.

It emphasizes the importance of regular cleaning and organization, as well as the use of storage solutions like shelves and drawers. The video also highlights the benefits of decluttering and the importance of keeping a clean and organized space. By following the tips and techniques shown in the video, teenagers can create a more organized and comfortable living environment.

321.question: How To Blow up a Balloon With Baking Soda and Vinegar
321.gt: To blow up a balloon with baking soda and vinegar, pour 1–2 inches of white vinegar into a plastic bottle. Next, hold a balloon loosely by the neck, fit a funnel or plastic straw into it, and pour 2 tablespoons of baking soda through it into the balloon. Then, stretch the neck of the balloon over the top of the bottle before lifting the balloon up over the bottle. The baking soda will fall out of the balloon, through the neck of the bottle, and into the vinegar. The 2 ingredients will fizz and react to create carbon dioxide, which will then inflate your balloon!
321.pred: To blow up a balloon with baking soda and vinegar, you will need a balloon, baking soda, vinegar, and a container. First, fill the container with vinegar. Then, add a spoonful of baking soda to the balloon. Next, place the balloon over the container and let the baking soda and vinegar mix. The reaction will cause the balloon to inflate.

338.question: How To Dissolve an Eggshell
338.gt: If you want to dissolve an eggshell, start by placing an egg in a glass and adding enough vinegar or cola to cover it. Once the egg is submerged, the chemical reaction between the acetic acid in the liquid and the calcium carbonate in the eggshell will cause the shell to dissolve. For the best results, cover the glass with some plastic wrap or foil, then place it on a shelf in your refrigerator for 24 hours. After a day has passed, carefully replace the vinegar in the glass with fresh vinegar and return the egg to the fridge for another 24 hours. Finally, remove the egg from the fridge to see if the shell is dissolved, and put it back for one more day if it isn't.
338.pred: To dissolve an eggshell, you need to put the egg in a glass and pour white vinegar into the glass to cover the egg. The acid in the vinegar will react with the calcium carbonate in the eggshell and slowly dissolve it. The chemical reaction produces carbon dioxide bubbles. You can see small bubbles forming around the entire egg. You can leave the egg in the vinegar for 24 hours. After 6 hours, the shell is already getting soft and the outer layer is starting to dissolve. Once you've left the egg in the vinegar for 24 hours, the shell has pretty much completely dissolved and they're held together with a very thin membrane which was underneath the shell.

373.question: How To Make a Newton Disc
373.gt: To make a Newton disc, start by cutting out two circles of the same size from a piece of cardboard and a piece of paper and gluing them together. Next, divide the circle into 7 equal triangles and color each section a different color in this order: red, orange, yellow, green, blue, indigo, and violet. Then, slide a pencil thorough the center of the disc and wrap some tape around the pencil above and below the disc so it doesn’t slide around. Finally, spin the disc quickly with your hand to see the colors blend together and appear white.

545.question: How To Paint an Old Wooden Chair
545.gt: Before painting an old wooden chair, wash it with soap and water to remove any debris or dirt. After allowing the chair to dry, use a coarse grit sandpaper to remove any paint chips, then use one with a finer grit to get rid of any scratches or dings. If any of the blemishes are too deep to be sanded out, fill them with wood putty. When you’re done sanding and filling in holes, use a tack cloth to remove any dust. Once the chair is dry, put it on a drop-cloth, apply a spray primer, and allow it to dry. Then, apply several light coats of your chosen spray paint. Allow the chair to dry, then put on a protective clear coat.
545.pred: To paint an old wooden chair, start by sanding the chair with 100 grit sandpaper to create a distressed look. Then, wipe the chair clean and free of dust. Next, apply Minwak's wood finish in Ebony color using a lint-free cloth that has been saturated. Cover the entire surface with the stain, and use an inexpensive throwaway brush to drive the stain into recessed areas with lots of detail. Finally, use a clean, lint-free cloth to buff the surface to a smooth, uniform finish.

561.question: How To Refinish a Dresser
561.gt: To refinish a dresser, start by removing any paint and stain using coarse-grit sandpaper wrapped around a wooden block or attached to a power sander. Then, once you see the original wood, switch to a medium- or fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out the surface of the dresser. If you're having trouble removing paint or stain, you may need to use a chemical stripper. Finally, once you've sanded down to the raw, original wood, apply a coat of primer and paint or stain the dresser.
561.pred: To refinish a dresser, first, ensure that you have a good quality piece of furniture. Next, get a paint sample to test the color in different lighting conditions. Remove the hardware and measure the holes to find the right replacement. Use a de-glosser to remove the sheen from the dresser, and then paint it in a well-ventilated area. Make sure to tape off areas to prevent paint from getting on unwanted surfaces. Allow the paint to dry completely before putting the dresser back in its place.

2908.question: How To Cook Turnips
2908.gt: Before you cook turnips, cut off their green stalks, rinse them in cool water, and peel them. Then, cut the turnips into thin strips that look similar to French fries. Next, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a pan over medium-low heat. Add 1 cup of onion and sauté it. When the onion begins to soften, add the turnips, along with another tablespoon of olive oil. Finally, cook the turnips for 5 minutes, reduce the heat to low, and continue cooking them until they’re tender.
2908.pred: To cook turnips, first cut the ends off and remove the skin. Then, slice the turnips thinly and dice them into large pieces. Pour enough water to float the turnips in a pot and add salt according to your preference. Taste the water and adjust the saltiness as needed. Bring the water to a rapid boil, then reduce the heat to a slow simmer and cook for 10 to 15 minutes until the turnips are translucent. Drain the water and add additional seasonings like black pepper and red pepper flakes. Serve and enjoy!

2931.question: How To Cook Red Cabbage
2931.gt: Before you cook red cabbage, rinse it, cut off the bottom, and remove the outer leaves. You can then cut the cabbage into wedges to boil or slow simmer it or into slices if you’d rather sauté it. To boil your cabbage, bring it to a boil in salted water and let it boil for an hour or until it’s tender. If you want your cabbage slow-simmered, boil the water before you add the cabbage and salt. Then, simmer the cabbage for 8-10 minutes per side. Alternatively, you can sauté your cabbage in olive oil with onion, apple cider vinegar, and mustard seed.
2931.pred: To cook red cabbage, you need to chop it up and put it in a frying pan with water and vinegar. Then, cover the pan with a lid and let it cook for 15 minutes. After that, add butter, brown sugar, and vestivia to the pan and stir it all up. Let it simmer for another 5 minutes, and then add bacon bits and feta cheese to the pan. Finally, transfer the cooked red cabbage to a dish and sprinkle feta cheese on top.

3578.question: How To Make a Cardboard Cat Igloo
3578.gt: To make a cardboard igloo for your cat, start by cutting out 6 cardboard circles that gradually increase in size. Make sure the biggest circle is large enough for your cat to curl up on, since that will be the floor inside the igloo. Then, cut out 33 more cardboard circles, making the first 10 gradually increase in size and the other 23 gradually decrease in size. With these circles, you'll also need to cut out the inner diameter so when you stack them there's a space inside the igloo for your cat. Additionally, you'll need to cut out an opening on one side of each of the first 21 circles you cut out, which will end up being the entrance to the igloo. After you cut out those 33 circles, cut out 5 more that gradually decrease in size. You don't need to cut out the interior diameter for these. Finish your igloo by stacking and gluing all of the circles together, starting with the first 6 circles you cut out for the floor.
3578.pred: To make a cardboard cat igloo, you will need a piece of cardboard, a marker, a pair of scissors, and a glue gun. First, draw a semi-circle on the cardboard using the marker. Then, cut out the semi-circle using the scissors. Next, fold the cardboard along the semi-circle to create a cone shape. Finally, use the glue gun to attach the two halves of the cardboard together to form the igloo.

3918.question: How To Make Caramelized Onions
3918.gt: To make caramelized onions, start by removing the onion's skin and cutting the onions into thin slivers. For every 2 and a half pounds of onions add 3 tablespoons of butter and 2 tablespoons of olive oil to a large skillet. Heat the skillet for 2-3 minutes. Then, add the onions to the skillet and season them with salt and pepper. Saute the onions for 5 minutes. Next, add 2 teaspoons of sugar and cook the onions for an additional 20 minutes, stirring frequently to prevent burning. You'll know they're done when the onions are soft and brown. Serve immediately and enjoy!
3918.pred: To make caramelized onions, you need to start by peeling the onions and cutting them into thin slices. Then, heat a skillet and add olive oil. Spread the onion slices evenly in the skillet and cook them for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add water to the skillet to help the onions cook evenly and to prevent them from sticking. Cover the skillet with a lid to trap the moisture and continue cooking for another 15 minutes. Finally, remove the lid and cook the onions for an additional 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they are caramelized and have a sweet, velvety texture.

4015.question: How To Cut a Straight Line
4015.gt: To cut a straight line without a ruler, start by folding your piece of paper so the fold is where you want the cut to be. Then, crease the fold, open the paper, and fold in the opposite direction along the same crease. Finally, unfold your paper and cut along the straight, creased line with scissors. You can also use a craft knife to cut through the crease if you don't have scissors on hand.

4086.question: How To Line a Dress
4086.gt: To line a dress, you’ll need to make the lining out of a thin, lightweight material that stretches as much as the dress itself. If your dress has a skirt, you'll need to sew the bottom of the lining around the hemline.

4104.question: How To Make Hamster Chew Sticks

6913.question: How To Install a New Toilet Seat
6913.gt: If your toilet's ready for a new seat, start by measuring the distance between the 2 bolts on the toilet bowl so you know what size seat to get. Most toilet seats are the same size, but it's better to check just in case! Once you've bought a new seat that fits, use a flathead screwdriver to pry off the caps on the bolts that attach the old seat to the bowl. If there aren't any caps, you can skip this step. Next, use an adjustable wrench to loosen and remove the nut on each bolt so you can lift the old seat off. When the old seat is off, hold the new seat over the toilet bowl, and drop the bolts into the empty holes where the old bolts were. Finish by threading the nuts onto the bolts to tighten the new seat into place.
6913.pred: To install a new toilet seat, first remove the old seat by unscrewing the bolts on the bottom of the toilet. Then, place the new seat over the holes and screw the bolts back in place. Make sure the nuts on the underside of the toilet match up with the bolts and tighten them until they are snug. Finally, snap the covers down to cover the bolt holes.

6947.question: How To Unblock a Toilet when You Have No Plunger
6947.gt: To unblock a toilet without a plunger, start by wrapping a plastic bag around the end of a mop. Then, use the mop to plunge the toilet like you would if you were using a plunger. You can also bend a metal coat hanger so it's curved and then use the curved end to plunge the toilet. If all else fails, try mixing baking soda and vinegar in a bowl and pouring it down the toilet. Let the mixture sit for 5-10 minutes and then flush the toilet.
6947.pred: To unblock a toilet without a plunger, you can use a plastic bag. First, open the bag and place your hand inside. Then, hold the bag down tight over the toilet drain. The water should start to go down, and the toilet will need some cleaning. After that, flush the toilet to make sure everything is fine.

7059.question: How To Make a Tube Top
7059.gt: If you have an old shirt you don’t use, you can easily transform it into a tube top. All you’ll need is a sewing kit, a strip of elastic, and scissors. To get started, first you'll need to cut across the top of the shirt, just below the armpits. You’ll use the bottom half to make your tube top. Then, you'll need to turn the material inside out, fold the cut edge back 1 inch, and sew it together. Make sure you leave a ½ inch gap at the back for the elastic. Once you’ve sewn the hem, you’ll want to cut the strip of elastic to fit around your chest, then feed it through the hem and sew it together in the gap you left.

7114.question: How To Clean Artificial Flowers
7114.gt: To clean silk flowers, start by filling your sink with room temperature water and a few drops of dish soap. Then, gently swish your flowers in the soapy water and rub them lightly to clean off the petals. When you're finished, immediately remove the flowers and gently blot them dry with a clean towel. If your flowers are hand wrapped, avoid swishing them in the water since it can erode the glue. Instead, you can place your flowers in a bag of salt and shake them for 1 minute to remove any dust and grime.
7114.pred: To clean artificial flowers, fill a bucket with warm water and a touch of soap. Dunk the flowers, leaves, berries, and eucalyptus in the water and gently use a cleaning toothbrush to clean the petals, leaves, berries, and other miscellaneous rickrack. You can then give them a shower under some running water. For arrangements that just need the quick touch up, you can use a can of silk and dried flower cleaner to blow off or disintegrate the dust.

7128.question: How To Dry Sunflowers
7128.gt: To dry sunflowers for seeds, let them mature and dry out in the ground if possible, or cut them 1 foot below the flower heads and dry them indoors if you're worried about pests or bad weather. If you dry them in the ground, protect the seeds from birds by wrapping cheesecloth or paper bags around the flowers’ heads once they begin to droop and die. Once the flowers have completely dried, remove the seeds by brushing them off with your fingers or a stiff brush.

Once the seeds have dried, they will fall loose in the bag, and you can collect them. You can then tie a string around the bag and suspend it in your garage or basement to allow the seeds to dry further.

7142.question: How To Make a Flower Press
7142.gt: To make a flower press, start by cutting out 2 equal-sized wooden squares that are big enough to cover the kinds of flowers you want to press. Then, drill a hole through each corner of the wooden squares. Next, cut 2 pieces of cardboard and paper so they're slightly smaller than the wooden squares and snip off the corners. Then, layer them on one of the squares and place a bolt through each of the holes you drilled. Finally, attach the other square to the bolts using washers and wingnuts.

Then, insert the flower cane into the cuts and gently press the flower petal cane around the flower cane. Finally, let the cane rest overnight to allow the flower to adhere to the cane.

7581.question: How To Make a Terrarium
7581.gt: To make a terrarium, start by choosing plants that are small and shade-loving. Select a glass container that is deep enough for your plants' roots in a shape that you like, then find an indoor location that gets plenty of light and maintains a consistent temperature. Clean out the container, then add a layer of rocks, a layer of moss, and 2-3 inches of potting soil. Add your plants and be sure to keep them watered and cared for as they grow!

7586.question: How To Make Pot Liners for Plants
7586.gt: Pot liners make it easier and cleaner to move plants between pots. To make pot liners for your plants, use a fabric, like burlap, or recycle plastic packaging like milk bottles. Start by placing your material into a pot and mark where you need to trim it with a pen or pencil. Then, use a pair of scissors to cut your material to size. You’ll want the pot liner to be well hidden in the pot but not so small that you can’t easily get hold of it. Once you’ve cut it to size, poke small drainage holes evenly across the bottom of the liner. It’s crucial that water can drain out of the liner.

7775.question: How To Make Movie Theater Popcorn
7775.gt: To make movie theater popcorn, start by melting 2 sticks of butter in the microwave. Then, let the butter sit until it separates into 3 distinct layers, which should only take a few minutes. Next, skim the foam off the top of the butter with a spoon, and pour the middle layer of butter into a separate container, throwing out the solids at the bottom. Finally, drizzle the clarified butter over some popcorn to give it a classic movie-theater flavor.
7775.pred: To make movie theater popcorn, you will need a popcorn machine, kernels, oil, and salt. First, turn on the warmer and stirrer. Then, measure out the oil and kernels using the measuring cups that come with the machine. Add the kernels and oil to the machine, and then add salt. Turn on the stirrer and let the popcorn pop. Once the popcorn is done, turn off the machine and remove the popcorn. You can add butter and more salt to taste.

8114.question: How To Make a Banana Split
8114.gt: To make a banana split, start by cutting a peeled banana in half lengthwise and placing the halves in a dish. Then, put 3 scoops of ice cream in the dish between the banana halves. Next, drizzle some chocolate or strawberry sauce over the ice cream and add a dollop of whipped cream on each scoop. Finally, sprinkle some chopped nuts over the sundae and place a maraschino cherry on top.
8114.pred: To make a banana split, you need to peel the bananas and cut them into slices. Then, you can add ice cream, whipped cream, and toppings like chocolate syrup, cherries, and nuts. You can also add other fruits or candies to make it more colorful and delicious.

8283.question: How To Make Corn Dogs
8283.gt: To make corn dogs, start by poking skewers through the base of uncooked, rinsed hot dogs. Next, make batter by mixing cornmeal, flour, baking powder, and salt, then whisking in milk, eggs, and sugar. Once the batter is smooth, pour it into a tall glass. Then, heat up oil in a frying pan until it reaches 360 degrees Fahrenheit. Now that you’re ready to fry your corn dogs, dip a hot dog in the batter, then place it in the oil, flipping once, until both sides are golden brown.
8283.pred: To make corn dogs, you will need 1 qt. of vegetable oil, 1 c. of flour, ¼ tsp. of salt, 1/8 tsp. of pepper, ¼ c. of baking powder, 1 c. of cornmeal, 1 c. of milk, 1 egg, 16 hot dogs, a deep saucepan, a food thermometer, a tall glass or mason jar, and 16 wooden skewers. First, heat the oil in a deep saucepan to 365 degrees. Then, combine all the ingredients in a mixing bowl and stir until smooth. Transfer some of the mixture to a tall glass or mason jar. Insert the wooden skewers into the ends of the hot dogs and dry them with paper towels. Dip the hot dogs in the batter in the glass or jar, shaking off the excess. Refill the glass as you go. Deep-fry two to three hot dogs at a time until they are golden brown, about 10 minutes. Remove them with tongs and place them on paper towels to drain. Serve them warm.

8516.question: How To Roast Baby Potatoes
8516.gt: To roast baby potatoes, preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit, and rinse 1 pound of potatoes under cool water. In a separate bowl, whisk together 1/4 cup of extra-virgin olive oil, 2 tablespoons of chopped rosemary, 1 minced garlic clove, 1.5 teaspoons salt, and 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper. Place the potatoes in a roasting pan and pour the mixture over them, using a spatula to ensure that each potato is coated. Place the potatoes in the oven to roast uncovered for 45 minutes, rotating them 2-3 times while they cook.

8616.question: How To Use Measuring Spoons and Cups
8616.gt: To use a measuring spoon, fill the spoon to the brim for both liquid and dry ingredients, unless the recipe says otherwise. If you're using a spoon for a dry ingredient, make sure you level off the ingredient by scraping a knife across the spoon. To use measuring cups, use dry cups for dry ingredients and wet cups for wet ingredients. For most dry ingredients, you should scrape a knife over the top of the cup to level off the ingredient inside. If a recipe calls for a packed cup, press the ingredients down in the cup with the back of a spoon.

Then, you can use the measuring spoons and cups to measure the ingredients accurately. You can also use the measuring spoons and cups to measure liquids and dry ingredients. 9098.question: How To Sew a Button
9098.gt: To sew a button, push a threaded needle up through the fabric and first hole. For a two-hole button, simply push the needle down through the second hole. For a four-hole button, push the needle through the hole opposite the one you started on. Repeat if your button has two holes, or alternate the threading between the two sets of holes if your button has four holes. When the button feels secure, push the needle down, tie a knot in the thread, and cut any excess.
9098.pred: To sew a button, you will need a button, needle, thread, scissors, and a straight pin or toothpick. First, select an appropriate button and matching thread for the article of clothing. Check to see if the manufacturer included extra buttons. Cut a suitable length of thread with scissors (12 to 18 inches is generally enough), and thread and knot your needle. Position the button and check to make sure it lines up with the buttonhole. If you are replacing a button, look for tiny holes in the fabric left by the previous button, and put your new button there. Make your first stitch by inserting the needle into the back of the fabric (where the knotted end won't show) and through one of the holes in the button. Be sure to pull the thread completely through on each stitch to keep it from bunching up. Take a pin or a toothpick, and center it on top of the button. This will create space between the button and the fabric, so that later the button will slip easily into the buttonhole. For now, hold the pin in place with your finger. Insert the needle through the next hole, into the fabric, and all the way through. This stitch will now hold the pin in place. Insert the needle back up through the fabric and into the first hole. If you have a four-hole button, stitch up through a new hole. Pull the thread all the way through. Keep repeating these stitches until the button is secure. This will usually take eight complete stitches. On your last stitch, end with a double knot on the back side of the fabric. Now cut the excess thread and remove the pin. Gently pull up on the button to create space for the fabric. Button up your refurbished article of clothing with pride.

9497.question: How To Make an Easy Chicken Salad
9497.gt: To make classic chicken salad, boil 2-3 cups of chicken breast for 15-20 minutes, strain the water, and chop the chicken coarsely. Next, combine the chicken with the veggies and apple in a large bowl. Then, mix  the mayonnaise, lemon juice, and berry preserves together in a separate bowl. Add salt and pepper to taste and drizzle the dressing over the salad. Finally, toss the salad and dressing together and serve it at room temperature.

Mix in half a cup of chopped onion and 3/4 of a cup of diced celery. Serve the chicken salad on a bed of spring mix or roll it up in a high fiber tortilla. 10511.question: How To Make Starbucks Coffee
10511.gt: If you want to make Starbucks coffee, use 2 tablespoons of ground coffee for each 6 ounces of water. Grind whole Starbucks coffee beans just before brewing for the freshest flavor, or purchase a Starbucks blend that’s already ground. Use filtered water heated to 195 to 205 °F, then brew your coffee in a press, a traditional drip coffee maker, or by pouring the hot water over very fine coffee grounds through a cone-shaped filter, all of which are methods used by Starbucks.

10577.question: How To Clean a Nespresso Machine
10577.gt: To clean a Nespresso machine, first put it in descaling mode. Next, fill the tank with equal parts water and either lemon juice or vinegar and place a container under the coffee outlet. Then, press any blinking coffee button to run the water through the machine and expel it into the container. Pour the water from the container back into the tank to descale again. Once done, rinse all of the parts in water before you go through the descaling process twice more, but this time with clean water instead of solution.

10892.question: How To Make Vanilla Extract
10892.gt: To make vanilla extract, start by lining up vanilla beans on a cutting board and slicing each bean lengthwise to cut them in half. Next, put the beans into a bottle of vodka, close the cap tightly, and shake the bottle. To infuse the vodka with vanilla, place the bottle in a cool, dark place and allow the extract to infuse for 2 months, shaking every so often. Then, put a colander over a bowl, pour the extract through, and use a funnel to transfer the extract to amber bottles to protect it from sunlight.

10953.question: How To Build a Pulley
10953.gt: A pulley is a simple machine that makes it easier to lift heavy objects, and you can make your own at home with just a clothes hanger, a pair of wire cutters, a spool, a rod, and a piece of string. First, cut the clothes hanger using wire cutters and place the spool onto the wire of the clothes hanger. Then, bend the wires to close the spool onto the clothes hanger. Hang the clothes hanger from a rod or dowel, like one you'd find in a closet. Finally, loop the piece of string over the top of the spool on the pulley. Now that the pulley is complete, attach lightweight objects to the end of the string to test how the machine works.

You can use a stationary pulley or a traveling pulley, depending on the type of pulley system you want to build. You can also use a change of direction pulley to change the direction of the haul. 10981.question: How To Get a Land Survey

11138.question: How To Change The Brake Pads in Your Car
11138.gt: Before you change the brake pads in your car, make sure it has had time to cool down so the brakes aren’t hot. Then, remove the wheel and the caliper to reveal the brake pads. Snap off the old brake pads and insert the new ones in the same position. If you want, you can spread anti-seize lubricant on the metal contact edges and on the back of the pads to prevent squeaking. Just don’t put lubricant inside the brakes or they won’t work.

11152.question: How To Fix a Brake Fluid Leak
11152.gt: If your brake fluid is leaking, first, find the source of the leak by looking underneath the car and spotting where the fluid is dripping. For example, if the leak is coming from the wheel, you may have to remove the wheel and check the lines and calipers. To fix a leaky caliper, purchase a caliper rebuild kit from an automotive store or dealership and remove your car’s brake bleeder. Then, disconnect the steel and rubber brake lines and replace them as well if they look cracked or worn out. Strip everything from the calipers so you can blow low-pressure compressed air into them to pop the piston out. From there, replace the piston and put the caliper back together. For more help from our co-author, including how to fix a leak in the wheel cylinder, read on.

11534.question: How To Make Garlic Knots

12649.question: How To Remove Dish Soap from a Dishwasher
12649.gt: To remove dish soap from a dishwasher, pour 1 cup of vinegar into the dishwasher and run it for a few minutes on a normal cycle. Then, check on the suds and pour more vinegar in if they're still there. You can also sprinkle table salt over the suds and then run the dishwasher, which will help break them down so they disappear. Pouring a cup of olive oil in the dishwasher before running it can also help clear out any dish soap residue.

12993.question: How To Make Natural Outdoor Fly Repellent with Essential Oils
12993.gt: To make natural outdoor fly repellent with essential oils, start by mixing lavender, citronella, eucalyptus, and peppermint essential oils in a bowl. Then, add some vegetable oil and witch hazel and pour the mixture into a metal tin. Submerge a cloth or sponge in the mixture and cover the tin for 24 hours. After 24 hours, open the tin and set it outside in the area you want to repel flies from.

13142.question: How To Clean Pool Tile
13142.gt: To clean calcium carbonate scaling on pool tile, scrub the scaling with a pumice stone or nylon bristle brush using circular motions. Just make sure the pool tile and pumice stone or brush are wet at all times so you don't accidentally scratch the tile. If you're having a hard time getting the scaling off, try spraying the tile with a non-toxic, biodegradable calcium releaser, which will soften the scaling without damaging your pool water.

14131.question: How To Cook Breakfast Sausage
14131.gt: To cook pan-fried breakfast sausage, place a medium non-stick skillet on the stove over medium-low heat and let it warm up for 1-2 minutes. Once the pan is hot, add the sausage in a single layer and cook until the sausage is fully cooked, turning the sausage frequently so it browns on all sides. Cook sausage links for 12-16 minutes, or cook sausage patties for 10-12 minutes. Add an additional 2 minutes if the sausage is frozen. Remove the sausage from the skillet and place it on a plate lined with paper towels for 1-2 minutes, then serve.

14133.question: How To Cook Italian Sausage
14133.gt: If you want to cook Italian sausage on the stovetop, heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add about a quarter-inch of water and a tablespoon of olive oil, then add the Italian sausage. Place a lid on the skillet and cook the sausage over medium-low heat for about 15 minutes, then remove the lid and continue cooking, flipping the sausage every 2-3 minutes, until the sausage is golden-brown or the internal temperature reads 150°-156°F.

15265.question: How To Braise Meat
15265.gt: To braise meat, start by searing each side of the meat in a pan over medium-high heat. Then, transfer the meat to large pot and pour in broth, beer, juice, or water until the liquid covers half of the meat. Next, bring the liquid in the pot to a boil. Once the liquid is boiling, cover the pot and place it in the oven. Cook the meat for 2-6 hours at 350 °F, or until it's tender.

15282.question: How To Cook Oxtails
15282.gt: If you want to cook oxtails on the stovetop, place the oxtails, salt, and any other seasonings you want to use in a large, heavy stockpot. Cover the oxtails with a combination of beef broth and red wine, then bring the liquid to a boil. After it begins to boil, stir the oxtails, cover the pot, and reduce the heat to medium or medium-low. Let the oxtails simmer for 2 1/2 to 3 hours, stirring every 15 to 30 minutes. If you like, you can make a gravy by heating oil, flour, and liquid from the stock pot in a skillet.

15283.question: How To Cook Liver and Onions
15283.gt: To cook liver and onions, use a sharp knife to cut your beef or chicken livers into 1/2-inch thick slices. Next, dredge the liver slices in a mixture of flour, black pepper, and salt, so they're evenly coated. When you're finished, cook the liver slices in olive oil over medium-high heat for 2-4 minutes, flipping them over halfway through so both sides are browned. Finally, add chicken or beef broth and 2 sliced onions to the skillet and simmer everything for 15-20 minutes.
15283.pred: To cook liver and onions, first, cut the onions into rings and place them on a plate. Then, add flour to the onions and mix them together. Next, place the onions in a pan and cook them until they are brown. Finally, add the liver to the pan and cook it until it is brown.

15351.question: How To Roast Meat
15351.gt: Before roasting beef or other meat, bring it to room temperature to ensure that it will cook evenly. Once the meat is ready to cook, place it in the oven uncovered to caramelize the outer portions. You'll want to cook the meat on a higher temperature to start, then roast it for several hours on a lower temperature for a tender final dish. Finally, use a meat thermometer to determine when the roast is done, cover it with aluminum foil, and allow it to rest for 10-20 minutes to seal in the juices.
15351.pred: To roast meat, you need to season the meat with salt and pepper, place it in a baking tray, add oil, and cook it in the oven. You can also add vegetables like potatoes, carrots, and brussels sprouts to the tray for a complete meal. After cooking, you can serve the meat with gravy and enjoy it with a side of Yorkshire puddings.

15379.question: How To Distress Wood Furniture
15379.gt: To distress wood furniture, start by sanding the entire surface with coarse-grit sandpaper to create a smooth base for the new paint to adhere to. Next, give the furniture a new coat of paint, use coarse-grit sandpaper or a sanding block to achieve an uneven, weathered look, and apply the top coat of paint. If you want a more distressed look, add cracks, holes, and scratches to the surface and replace the current hardware with antique or weathered pieces.
15379.pred: To distress wood furniture, you can use a sanding block to sand the wood and create a distressed look. You can also use a drill to make holes in the wood and add a distressed finish. Additionally, you can use a wood stain to add color and texture to the wood.

15395.question: How To Remove Paint from Wooden Objects and Refinish Them
15395.gt: If you want to remove paint from a wooden object, sand it down until all of the paint is removed, then clean away the dust using a rug covered in paint solvent. If the paint is thick or the wood is polished, use a scraper to scrape off the paint. Alternatively, apply a chemical stripper to the object using a paint brush, leave it to soften the paint for 30 minutes, and scrape off the paint with a spatula. To finish, sand the item with sandpaper. If you want you're item to have a new finish, try giving it a coat of clear timber varnish.
15395.pred: To remove paint from wooden objects, you can use a citrus stripper and apply it evenly with a paintbrush. Then, use a putty knife to scrape off any finishes. After that, apply lacquer thinner to activate the stripper and stop it from continuing to strip the furniture. For refining the wooden objects, sand them with a 220 grit sanding block to make them smooth and even.

15409.question: How To Waterproof Wood
15409.gt: To waterproof wood, start by sanding it with fine grit sandpaper to remove any imperfections and prep the surface. Then, use a rag to apply an even coat of linseed oil, walnut oil, or tung oil to the wood and let it cure for 24 hours. Repeat the process 2 more times so there are 3 coats of oil on the wood. When you're finished, let the wood cure for several days before using it.
15409.pred: To waterproof wood, you should use oil-based semi-gloss enamel and marine grade sealant. Apply the enamel with a roller and use two coats. Apply the sealant around the edges of the wood to prevent water from getting in.

15466.question: How To Cook Leeks
15466.gt: To cook leeks, start by cutting off the roots and leafy tops from the stalks. Then, add the leeks to a pot of boiling water and turn the heat down to medium-low. Let the leeks simmer for 20-30 minutes or until they're tender. You can also cook the leeks by frying them in a pan with butter or oil until they're crispy and golden brown. Once the leeks are finished cooking, serve them as is or incorporate them into a recipe like fish and rice, mashed potatoes, or baked chicken.
15466.pred: To cook leeks, first, remove the roots and the outer layer of the leek. Then, trim both ends of the leek and cut it into four pieces. Next, wash the leeks thoroughly under cold water, making sure to remove any dirt or soil. Finally, you can use the leeks in your recipe as desired.

15502.question: How To Grill Vegetables
15502.gt: To grill vegetables on a gas grill, start by preheating the grill for at least 10 minutes. If you have a charcoal grill, heat until the charcoal has turned gray. Next, clean between the nooks and crannies of the grate with a grill brush, and wipe down the grate with a paper towel dipped in oil to prevent sticking. Then, coat your vegetable lightly with oil and place them on the grill. If the vegetables are small enough to fall through the grate, place them in a grilling basket, or wrap them in tin foil with the top left open.
15502.pred: To grill vegetables, preheat a grill pan for at least 10 minutes over medium-high heat. Group the vegetables by size and shape, and precook dense vegetables like carrots, potatoes, and artichokes. Coat the vegetables with oil and seasoning, then load them into the grill pan, packing them in pretty close. Cook the vegetables for 15-20 minutes, stirring or turning them every few minutes, until they are caramelized and tender.

15541.question: How To Make Glazed Carrots
15541.gt: To make honey glazed carrots, start by melting 2 tablespoons of butter in a skillet over medium heat and adding 2 tablespoons of honey and 2 tablespoons brown sugar. Next, give the mixture a brisk stir with a fork or mini whisk to combine. Then, add peeled, cut carrots and cook for about 15 minutes so the carrots turn tender and become infused with the glaze. As the carrots cook, make sure to stir them occasionally to prevent scorching. Finally, transfer the carrots to a dish and serve!
15541.pred: To make glazed carrots, you will need 2 pounds of baby carrots, 1 1/4 cup of brown sugar, 1/4 cup of honey, 1/4 cup of butter, 1/8 tsp of white pepper, and 1/4 tsp of salt. First, place the carrots in a pot of water and bring the water to a boil. Cook the carrots for 12 minutes or until they reach your desired texture. In a saucepan, melt the butter and add the brown sugar, salt, pepper, and honey. Cook until the sugar has dissolved. Add the carrots to the glaze and cover. Cook for another 5 minutes, and the glazed carrots are ready to serve.

16231.question: How To Clean an Iron with Vinegar
16231.gt: Before you start cleaning your iron, make sure the iron is unplugged and allow it to cool completely. Once it's cooled completely, use a toothpick or cotton swab to remove any residue from the holes in the iron’s soleplate. Then, pour a mixture of distilled water and white vinegar into the water reservoir until it is about one-third full. Heat up the iron for five minutes, and then press the steam button for 20-30 seconds repeatedly until the steam flows freely. To clear out any remaining traces of vinegar, fill the reservoir with just distilled water and run the steam function again.
16231.pred: To clean an iron with vinegar, you will need an old towel, an old brush, a small jar, and vinegar. First, pour vinegar into the tank where you usually pour water, and fill it up to one-fourth. Then, close the lid and pour the solution into the iron. Place the iron on the towel and iron it while spraying vinegar. The dirty marks on the towel are the clogged dirt in the holes of the base. Repeat the process for 5-10 minutes until the water is finished. Make sure the steam nozzle is at the maximum power. After that, use the brush to clean the surface of the iron.

16236.question: How To Heat Press a T‐Shirt
16236.gt: If you're ready to print onto a t-shirt using a heat press, open the press and set it to the temperature recommended by your transfer paper. Next, turn the nob clockwise to adjust the pressure according to the thickness of your t-shirt. To use the press, put the t-shirt on the panel with the side facing up you want to print on. Finally, place the transfer face down on top of the t-shirt, close the press, and press the t-shirt for the length of time recommended for the type of transfer you're using.
16236.pred: To heat press a t-shirt, you will need a heat press machine, a heat press sheet, and a t-shirt. First, place the heat press sheet on the heat press machine. Then, place the t-shirt on top of the heat press sheet. Make sure the t-shirt is flat and smooth. Next, place the heat press sheet on top of the t-shirt. Close the lid of the heat press machine and set the temperature to the appropriate level for the type of heat press sheet you are using. Press the t-shirt for the recommended amount of time, usually around 30 seconds to 1 minute. Once the heat press is complete, remove the t-shirt from the heat press machine and let it cool for a few minutes. Finally, remove the heat press sheet and inspect the t-shirt to make sure the design has transferred properly.

16248.question: How To Make Liquid Starch
16248.gt: To make your own liquid starch, pour 24 ounces of distilled or filtered water in a spray bottle. Add 3 ounces of vodka to the bottle, or about 2 shots worth. If you’d like to make scented starch, mix 2-3 drops of your favorite essential oil, like lavender or lemon, to the bottle. However, if you do this, make sure you use a glass bottle, as the oils will degrade plastic over time. Once you’ve added all of the ingredients, close the bottle and shake it up until everything is thoroughly mixed.
16248.pred: To make liquid starch, you need to boil water in a pot, add cornstarch to it, and stir until it thickens.

16250.question: How To Remove Iron On Patches
16250.gt: To remove iron-on patches, start by placing a clean cloth or piece of wax paper over the patch. Then, press down on the patch with a heated iron for 15 seconds, which will melt the glue. After 15 seconds, remove the iron and peel the patch off. If the patch won't come off, reapply the heat until the glue on the patch is melted enough.
16250.pred: To remove iron on patches, you can use a lint remover to clean the surface. The video shows a person using a lint remover to clean a surface, which can be used to remove iron on patches.

16303.question: How To Roast Corn
16303.gt: The easiest way to roast corn is to trim off the silky tassels and place the corn directly onto your oven rack with the husk still on. If you want the kernels to get soft and juicy, remove the husk and wrap the corn in foil before placing it on a baking sheet. You can also place the shucked corn onto a foil-lined baking sheet for a crisp brown finish. No matter which approach you use, roast the corn in the oven on the center rack at 400 °F for 25-30 minutes.
16303.pred: To roast corn, first, remove the husk and place the corn on an open flame. Keep rotating the corn to ensure it gets dark from all sides. Once the corn is done, take a lemon wedge and rub it on the corn along with chaat masala or cayenne pepper. The video also shows that the corn may pop due to the heat, and if it catches fire, blow it out.

16328.question: How To Steam Cabbage
16328.gt: To steam cabbage in a microwave, start by removing the outer leaves and cutting the cabbage into halves or quarters. Then, cut away the core from each section, and shred the cabbage or leave it in big pieces. Next, place the cabbage in a microwave-safe dish, and add 2-3 tablespoons of water. Finally, cover the dish with plastic wrap, and microwave the cabbage for around 5 minutes, or until it's tender.
16328.pred: To steam cabbage, you can follow the steps shown in the video. First, cut the cabbage into small pieces and place them in a pot. Then, add water to the pot and cover it with a lid. Bring the water to a boil and let the cabbage steam for about 10-15 minutes, or until it is tender. You can also add some seasonings like salt, pepper, or garlic to the water for extra flavor. Once the cabbage is cooked, drain the water and serve it as a side dish.

16400.question: How To Clean Your Hair With Beer
16400.gt: Before you wash your hair with beer, leave a glass of beer out overnight so it decarbonates because carbon dioxide can harm your hair when combined with water. When you're ready to wash your hair, use shampoo as normal. Next, cover your hair with beer and rub it into your scalp for 1 minute. To rinse out the beer, use water to wash it off before towel drying your hair. If you intend to do a beer wash regularly, restrict it to 1-2 times a week as more frequent washes can dry out your hair.
16400.pred: To clean your hair with beer, you can follow these steps. First, decarbonate your beer by letting it sit overnight or throughout the day. Then, shampoo your hair with your usual shampoo but skip the conditioner. Next, massage your hair with beer for about a minute. After that, rinse the beer off, leaving it in your hair for a better effect. It's recommended to only do the beer wash a few times a week as it can be quite drying for hair if used every day.

16430.question: How To Make Tepache
16430.gt: To make traditional tepache, slice off the base and stem of a whole pineapple and cut it into 1-inch cubes, leaving the rind intact. Next, bring a mixture of piloncillo, cinnamon, cloves, and water to a boil, then reduce the heat and let the mixture simmer for 10 minutes. Once the piloncillo dissolves, add the pineapple chunks, cover the pot, and let it ferment for 2 days before adding a can of light beer. Finally, let the mixture stand for 12 hours, strain it through a cheesecloth, and refrigerate it before serving.
16430.pred: To make tepache, you will need to mix water, yeast, honey, and flour in a bowl. After mixing, let the yeast activate for 10 minutes. Then, add olive oil and flour to the mixture and knead the dough. After kneading, let the dough rest for 30 minutes at 80 degrees Fahrenheit. Once the dough has rested, spread olive oil on a baking sheet and place the dough on it. Then, poke holes in the dough with a fork and bake it for 20 minutes at 430 degrees Fahrenheit.

16694.question: How To Make Cucumber Sandwiches
16694.gt: To make a basic cucumber sandwich, start by peeling the skin away from the cucumber and cutting it into thin, crisp slices. Next, let the cucumber drain in a colander for 10 minutes so your sandwich won't up soggy. Then, combine the cream cheese, Worcestershire sauce, mayonnaise, garlic powder, and onion salt. Finally, spread the cream cheese mixture on 2 pieces of bread and sandwich a few slices of cucumber in between them.
16694.pred: To make cucumber sandwiches, you will need a cucumber, a knife, a cutting board, a vegetable peeler, a sandwich bread, butter, salt, and pepper. First, peel the cucumber with the vegetable peeler and cut it into three parts. Then, slice the cucumber into thin slices. Next, spread softened butter on a sandwich bread and season it with salt and pepper. Arrange the cucumber slices over the buttered bread and top it with another slice of buttered bread. You can use either white or wheat bread for the sandwiches. Finally, cut the sandwich into two halves and serve it with black tea.

16944.question: How To Make a Stuffed Animal at a "Build a Bear" Workshop
16944.gt: To make a stuffed animal at a “Build A Bear” Workshop, start by picking out an animal from one of the bins near the entrance. Then, select a sound chip if you want your animal to speak. Additionally, choose a scent disk in scents like chocolate or bubblegum to give your furry friend a special smell. Next, go to the stuffing machine and give your animal, sound chip, and scent disk to the stuffer. Once the stuffer holds your animal up to the stuffing machine, press the machine’s pedal or turn its handle to stuff your new furry friend!

17266.question: How To Get Rid of Ground Digger Wasps (Cicada Killers) from Your Lawn
17266.gt: To get rid of ground digger wasps or cicada killers from your lawn, mark every hole you see with a plastic knife. Then, at 11 p.m. or later, pour a solution of 50% vinegar and 50% water into each hole, putting 2 to 3 cups in each hole. Come back out the next day, mark any new holes you see, and repeat the process until they are all dead.
17266.pred: To get rid of ground digger wasps, you need to purchase a large bag of white plastic knives and up to three or four jug gallons of regular or lemon ammonia. During the day, mark each nest with a plastic knife, and at night, pour ammonia into the holes. Repeat the process on any new nests the next day.

17281.question: How To Tint Bottles and Jars
17281.gt: Tinted bottles and jars can make a great decorative addition to your home. To make one, you’ll need a clean jar, food coloring, and Mod Podge. First, pour 3 parts Mod Podge and 1 part water into a measuring cup. Add the food coloring you want until you get a deep color. Make sure to mix everything well so the food coloring is totally absorbed into the solution. Pour a small amount into your jar or bottle, then swirl it around so it covers the sides. Then, pour out the excess solution and allow your jar to set for 1 hour. Once it’s set, bake your bottle or jar at the lowest temperature for 20 minutes.

17303.question: How To Glue Plexiglas
17303.gt: To glue plexiglas, start by cleaning the surface with mild soap and water and drying it with a clean cloth. Next, fit the glass pieces together to ensure a snug fit and secure them in place with masking tape or clamps. Then, use a 25 gauge syringe to apply methylene chloride glue to the joint between the two glass pieces. Finally, let the glue set for 24-48 hours to ensure a secure bond. After the glue is set, you can use fine-grit sandpaper to smooth out any rough patches on the joint.
17303.pred: To glue plexiglas, you can use acetone as a solvent. First, place the two pieces of plexiglas together and let them sit. Then, fold the end of a syringe on the edge of the work surface of the two pieces to be bonded together. Apply a little bit of acetone to the gap between the pieces and let it sit for about a day. The acetone will spread out inside the material and create a strong bond.

17508.question: How To Paint a Wall
17508.gt: Before you start painting your wall, remove outlet covers and light switches as well cover adjacent surfaces with painter's tape. Then, apply a primer to help the paint stick as well as cut down on the number of coats you’ll have to apply. Wait 4 hours for the primer to dry, then paint the trim by hand. Once the trim is finished, use a wide roller to cover the middle section of the wall. Wait 2-3 hours for the paint to dry before applying another coat.
17508.pred: To paint a wall, first, you need to prepare the surface by cleaning it and applying a primer if necessary. Then, you can use a paint roller to apply the paint in a horizontal motion, starting from the top and working your way down. It's important to use a steady hand and apply even pressure to avoid brush marks. If you're painting a bathroom wall, it's best to run the roller along the top edge of the tiles to eliminate any brush marks. Finally, you can finish the wall off with a second coat of paint if necessary.

17509.question: How To Paint the Interior of a House
17509.gt: After you’ve bought your materials, prepare by removing all the furniture from the room. Next you can wash the walls and fill in any holes with spackle. Make sure to lay drop cloths or old sheets on the ground to protect the floor from paint. When you’re ready to paint, start with a layer of primer to cover all the walls. Once that has dried, you can paint with color. Use small brushes to paint edges and large rollers to cover the rest.
17509.pred: To paint the interior of a house, start by preparing the room by removing small pieces of furniture and spreading a drop sheet over the floor. Cover bigger pieces of furniture with a protective sheet. Then, prepare the surfaces by removing any exposed nails or screws and filling holes and cracks with a patching compound. Protect moldings and casings with masking tape on the areas that have been repaired. Apply a first coat of primer, followed by a second thick coat of primer on all surfaces. Let the primer dry before painting. Start by painting the ceiling, then the walls, and finally the moldings and casings. Clean your paintbrushes with soap and lukewarm water for latex paint or with solvent for oil-based paint. If you'll reuse the paintbrushes within the next few days, seal them in plastic wrap. Store the paint in a hermetically sealed container and keep it in a room where the temperature is neither too cold nor too hot.

17524.question: How To Paint a Bathroom
17524.gt: To paint a bathroom, use a mildew-resistant, satin or semi-gloss paint since they're durable and water resistant. To get started, clean the bathroom walls and cover anything that you don't want to paint with plastic or drop cloths. Then, paint the ceiling and trim first, using a roller for most of the ceiling and a paint brush for the edges and trim. Next, apply a paint primer to the walls if you're making a drastic color change or patching any holes. Finally, use a roller and paint brush to apply 2 coats of paint to the walls, letting them dry after each coat.
17524.pred: To paint a bathroom, first, paint the wall tiles horizontally along the top edge to eliminate any brush marks. Then, finish the wall off normally.

17563.question: How To Paint Laminate Cabinets
17563.gt: To paint laminate cabinets, start by removing the hardware, cleaning the surface, and sanding the cabinets with medium-grit sandpaper until the surface feels smooth. Next, roll on a coat of bonding primer and let it dry completely. Then, roll on 2-3 coats of paint, letting each coat dry completely before adding a new one. You can use an angled paintbrush to paint the areas that your roller can't reach easily, such as the edges and borders. Finally, let the paint dry for 6-8 hours before applying a polycrylic sealant.
17563.pred: To paint laminate cabinets, first remove the doors and drawers and set them aside. Then, remove the hardware and label them according to the type. Create a well-ventilated space and put on safety clothing. Sand the exterior surfaces of the cabinet boxes, drawers, and both sides of the doors with 80-grit sandpaper. Vacuum the entire area and cabinet boxes with a shop vacuum. Wipe the surfaces of the cabinets with tack cloths. Spray the surfaces of the cabinets with an oil-based spray primer. Allow the primer to dry and then sand the cabinets with 220-grit sandpaper. Buy high-quality interior paint and test the paint colors before applying them to the entire cabinet set. Paint the surfaces of the cabinets with the latex paint using a small foam roller set for doors and large areas of the cabinet box and a paint brush for crevices and smaller areas. Allow the paint to dry and apply a second coat. Apply a finishing material to the cabinets, such as a finishing wax or clear lacquer. Let the paint cure on the cabinets, doors, and drawers for 2 days to 2 weeks depending on the ventilation and heat during the project. Reattach the hardware and drawers and doors. Remove the drop cloths and clean up the area around the cabinets using a shop vacuum and detergent.

17566.question: How To Paint Melamine
17566.gt: To paint melamine, you'll need primer designed specifically for melamine or laminate wood as well as some melamine paint. To get started, rough up the melamine with 150-grit sandpaper so the primer and paint sticks to it better. You can apply a liquid deglosser to the melamine for 15 minutes instead if you're in a rush. Next, apply 2 coats of primer, letting it dry after each coat. Finally, apply 2 coats of melamine paint using a paintbrush or spray canister and then let everything dry for 24 hours.
17566.pred: To paint melamine, you need to sand the surface with 100 grit sandpaper, wipe it down with a damp cloth, and apply a thin coat of acrylic primer. Wait for the primer to dry before applying the top coat. It's important to watch for any buildup of paint on the edges and to use a light roller to pop any bubbles in the paint. Let the top coat dry for at least two or three days before using the painted surface.

17642.question: How To Prepare for a Night of Drinking
17642.gt: To prepare for a night of drinking, start by getting plenty of rest and eating a good, protein-rich meal beforehand, since you definitely don't want to drink on an empty stomach. Alcohol can impair decision-making abilities, so it's a good idea to agree on a plan for the night with your friends before going out. Then, choose a designated driver or arrange to use a taxi or public transportation to get around safely.
17642.pred: To prepare for a night of drinking, you can start by making cocktails like the Amaro Sour and the Ferrari. You can also enjoy a drink with friends at a bar or restaurant. Additionally, you can have a conversation with someone while drinking.

17656.question: How To Get Acrylic Paint Out of Clothes
17656.gt: To get wet acrylic paint stains out of clothes, first run the stains under cold water to flush out as much of the paint as possible. Then, apply a commercial stain remover to the stains. Machine wash your garment using warm water, and the stains should be gone! For acrylic paint stains that are already dry, start by dabbing the stains with some rubbing alcohol and a cloth until you see some of the color transfer to the cloth. You can also use nail polish remover, hairspray, or another alcohol-based product. Finally, apply a stain remover, and machine wash your garment with warm water. Remember not to dry your clothing until the acrylic paint is completely gone since it could cause the stains to set. If your stain has already set, read on for ways to remove acrylic paint with hairspray, vinegar, or isopropyl alcohol!
17656.pred: To get acrylic paint out of clothes, you need an old toothbrush and some alcohol. Soak the fabric with the alcohol and then use the toothbrush to scrub the area with the paint. The video shows that this method works well, and the paint can be completely removed. However, it is important to note that this method may not work for all types of fabric, and it is recommended to use clothes that you are not too concerned about when painting.

17658.question: How To Get Paint Out of Jeans
17658.gt: To get paint out of jeans that's water-based, start by pouring warm water over the stain. Then, apply laundry detergent to the stain and rub it in with a damp cloth. If the paint doesn't come out, try dabbing it with rubbing alcohol and scrubbing it with a clean toothbrush until all the paint is gone. If you're dealing with oil-based paint, scrape the paint off with a blunt knife. If that doesn't help, cover the stain with glycerin, which will dissolve the paint. Let the glycerin sit on the jeans overnight before machine washing them.
17658.pred: The video shows that vinegar and isopropyl alcohol are ineffective in removing paint from jeans. The person in the video suggests using a Sharpie marker to cover the paint and then washing the jeans. However, it is important to note that this method may not be effective in removing all the paint and may cause damage to the fabric. It is recommended to avoid getting paint on your clothes in the first place.

17795.question: How To Clean Soft Ballet Slippers
17795.gt: It’s important to clean your soft ballet slippers the right way to keep them looking nice. 22649.question: How To Make a Cheese Omelette
22649.gt: To make a cheese omelette, first crack 2 eggs into a mixing bowl. Then, add 2 tablespoons (30 mL) of water and a dash of salt and pepper. Next, heat 1 tablespoon (14 g) of butter in a pan over medium heat until it melts and coats the bottom of the pan. Then, pour in the egg mixture. After about 10 seconds, use a spatula to gently guide the egg into the middle and away from the sides. Keep doing this until the egg firms up. Now, sprinkle ⅓ cup (42 g) of grated cheese on one half of the cooked egg, and fold the other half over the cheese using the spatula. Finally, cook the omelette for 30 more seconds, or until the egg is completely cooked through, and enjoy!

24319.question: How To Make Apple Crumble

Next, combine 2/3 cups (80 grams) of flour, 2 tablespoons of granulated sugar, 1/2 cup (100 grams) of brown sugar, and 1/2 tsp of cinnamon in a large mixing bowl. Cut 6 tablespoons of chilled unsalted butter into the mixture with a fork or a pastry cutter. Cutting in simply means combining the butter with the flour until it reaches a crumbly sandy texture. Be careful not to overwork the butter or it will become too soft and more difficult to work with. Pour the crumble topping over the apples and bake it for 45 minutes or until golden. Serve and enjoy!

25733.gt: To make watermelon wine, heat chunks of watermelon over a medium heat for 30 minutes so they break down into juice. Then, strain 14 cups of juice to get rid of any seeds before adding the juice to a pot with sugar. Heat the pot until it's almost boiling, then add acid blend and yeast nutrient. Next, transfer the juice to a fermentation container and wait 24 hours before adding champagne yeast. After another day, rack the wine, then leave it for 3 months. Finally, rack the wine again, leave it for 2 months, rack it for a third time, and leave it  for another month.
25733.pred: To make watermelon wine, you will need a large watermelon, sugar, yeast nutrient, and acid blend. First, cut the watermelon into small pieces and cook them in a pot. Then, add sugar to the pot and stir until it dissolves. Next, add yeast nutrient and acid blend to the pot and stir. Finally, let the mixture cool down and transfer it to a fermenter. Allow the mixture to ferment for two weeks in the primary fermenter, then move it to a secondary fermenter for six weeks. After that, bottle the wine and let it age for however long you like.

25737.question: How To Make Wine Glass Charms
25737.gt: To make wine glass charms, start by picking up some ring-sized memory wire from the craft store. If you have longer memory wire, use heavy-duty wire cutters to cut it to about an inch and a half. Next, use a pair of pliers to pinch the end of the wire into a small loop. Now that you’ve secured one end of the wire, add beads or charms. Once you’ve affixed all the decorations you want, make another loop at the other end of the wire. Finally, attach the charm to a wine glass.
25737.pred: To make wine glass charms, you will need ring memory wire, round nose pliers, a headpin, and some beads. First, cut the ring memory wire to a length that is just enough to fit on and off your wine glass. Then, use the round nose pliers to make a loop on one end of the wire. Hang a small charm, such as a pink cocktail glass, on the loop. Next, make a loop at the top of the headpin and link the loops together. Slide the beads down the wire to the end. Repeat the same steps on the opposite side of the wire to create a second loop. This will prevent the beads from falling off when the charm is on the wine glass. The wine glass charms are great party favors or holiday gift ideas.

25849.question: How To Use Stevia
25849.gt: To use stevia, use a few drops of it as a substitute for 1-2 teaspoons of white sugar. You can add the drops to drinks, sauces, salad dressings, and soups. If you have stevia powder, use half as much as you normally would for sugar. For example, if you're baking something and it calls for 1 cup of sugar, use 1/2 cup of stevia instead.

Let it sit for 24 hours and then store it in the refrigerator. You can use the pure stevia powder to replace sugar in recipes, and the liquid stevia can be used to make lemonade or other drinks.

25935.question: How To Make Rum
25935.gt: To make rum, dissolve sugar and molasses in hot water, let it cool, and add hydrated yeast. Let that mixture ferment for a couple days before you chill it to knock the yeast to the bottom of the bucket. Then, distill the rum by running a siphon from the mash to a collection tank. As the rum evaporates, it will condense in the siphon and flow into the other container.
25935.pred: To make rum, you need to ferment the mixture of molasses and sugar, then still and filter it. You can add a bottle of flavor to make it taste like rum. Alternatively, you can add molasses and brown sugar syrup directly into the ferment to make it taste rummy. You can also color it up with wood chips.

26654.question: How To Make Chocolate Martinis
26654.gt: To make a classic chocolate martini, first prepare the garnish by placing chocolate liqueur and cocoa powder in separate dishes. Next, dunk the rim of a martini glass into the liqueur and then the cocoa powder to coat the rim. Then, add ice, liqueur, vodka, and half and half to a cocktail shaker and shake for 20 seconds until the ingredients are thoroughly combined. Finally, pour the martini into the rimmed glass and serve while chilled.
26654.pred: To make chocolate martinis, you will need a mixing cup, ice, vodka, chocolate liquor, a stem cocktail glass, and sweet cocoa powder. First, coat the rim of the glass with sweet cocoa powder by squeezing lime juice on the edge and swirling it in the chocolate. Then, add ice to the mixing cup and pour in 1 oz of vodka and 1 oz of chocolate liquor. Shake the mixture well and strain it into the chilled glass. Enjoy your delicious chocolate martini!

27166.question: How To Give a Rectal Exam
27166.gt: To give a rectal exam, first lubricate your gloved finger with warm petroleum jelly to keep the anal canal relaxed. Then, with your patient on their side, assess their anus for abnormalities, such as hemorrhoids, warts, rashes, or fissures. When you’ve checked their anus, ask your patient to take a deep breath to relax them and prevent their sphincter contracting. Next, part their buttocks and gently insert your finger into their anal canal. Once your finger is inside, rotate it to feel for any abnormalities, like bumps, hard spots, soft spots, or fissures.

The doctor then gently presses their finger against the patient's rectum to feel the prostate gland. The doctor should also ask the patient to take a deep breath and hold it for a few seconds before exhaling slowly. 27322.question: How To Infuse Vodka With Watermelon
27322.gt: To infuse vodka with watermelon, start by cutting a watermelon up into small, 1-inch cubes. Then, place the cubes in a jar and fill the jar with vodka so the cubes are completely submerged. Next, seal the jar and store it in a cool, dark place for at least 6 days. Finally, place a cheesecloth or tea towel over the mouth of the jar and strain the watermelon-infused vodka into a new container.
27322.pred: To infuse vodka with watermelon, you need to cut a hole in the watermelon and insert a bottle of vodka into it. Then, you can add other liquids like rum, gin, tequila, and triple sec to the watermelon. After that, you should let the watermelon sit for 24 hours or more to allow the liquids to seep in. Finally, you can slice the watermelon and enjoy the infused vodka.

27328.question: How To Make Alcohol from Common Table Sugar
27328.gt: To make alcohol from common table sugar, start by getting a food-grade plastic container or a glass carboy to use as a fermentation vessel for your alcohol. Then, dissolve 15-20 pounds of sugar in a pot of warm water before pouring it into your fermentation vessel. Next, add a packet of yeast and let the mixture sit, uncovered, for 24 hours. After 24 hours, put the lid on the vessel, attach a water-filled airlock to the lid, and let the mixture ferment for 2-10 days. Finally, purify the fermented alcohol before siphoning it off.
27328.pred: To make alcohol from common table sugar, you will need to mix three kilos of ordinary white sugar with three litres of molasses. Then, add a packet of distillers yeast for rum to the mixture. The yeast will ferment the sugar and molasses, producing alcohol. After fermentation, you can add wood chips to the mixture to give it a brown color. Finally, you can run the mixture through a still to separate the alcohol from the other components.

27717.question: How To Make Hungarian Goulash
27717.gt: To make Hungarian goulash, saute a chopped onion in vegetable oil over medium heat until it turns golden. Remove the pan from the heat, then stir in paprika, cubed beef, a pinch of salt, and water to the pan and put it back on the heat. Cook the ingredients for 6-8 minutes, then add all of the remaining ingredients except the potatoes and simmer until the meat is nearly cooked. Add the potatoes and turn down the heat, simmering for another 20 minutes or until the potatoes are tender.
27717.pred: To make Hungarian goulash, you will need the following ingredients: 1.5 lbs of beef, 1 onion, 2 carrots, 1/2 cup of flour, 1/2 cup of paprika, 1/2 cup of garlic, 1/2 cup of black pepper, 1/2 cup of salt, and 1/2 cup of carrots. First, heat up a pan with oil and add the beef, onions, and carrots. Cook for 5-10 minutes until the vegetables are soft. Then, add the flour and stir until it becomes a paste. Next, add the paprika, garlic, and black pepper. Stir everything together and let it cook for 20 minutes. Finally, add the salt and carrots and let it cook for another 20 minutes. Serve with mashed potatoes and enjoy your delicious Hungarian goulash!

27762.question: How To Make Resin Jewelry
27762.gt: To make resin jewelry, start by combining equal amounts of polyurethane casting resin and a resin catalyst. Then, pour enough of the mixture into a jewelry mold to cover the bottom of the mold. Next, turn on a hair dryer and hold it 4 inches above the resin to remove any air bubbles. Let the resin harden for 15 minutes, then add your embellishments, such as flowers or feathers, and pour another layer of resin over the embellishment. Afterwards, use the hair dryer again to remove any bubbles, then cover the mold and let the resin cure overnight.
27762.pred: To make resin jewelry, you will need to mix and tint the resin using acrylic paints, inks, and powder pigments. You can use a flower-shaped container to mix the resin and then pour it into a mold. Once the resin has hardened, you can add a metal ring to the center of the resin and create a pendant or earring. The video also shows how to add gold leaf to the resin for a unique touch.

27766.question: How To Make Sterling Silver Jewelry
27766.gt: The easiest way for a beginner to make sterling silver jewelry is to mold sterling silver clay into the desired shape. Next, either allow it to dry overnight or use a hairdryer, then use tweezers to place the dry silver clay onto a piece of stainless steel mesh over a stove burner. Use a low flame until the clay burns off, then raise the heat until the remaining silver glows red. After 10 minutes, turn off the heat and let your silver cool.

Then, you will need to fire coat the pieces in boric acid and denatured alcohol, and then flame them off with a lighter. After that, you will need to add a little dab of sterling silver solder paste to the pieces and then heat them up with a torch until the solder begins to flow. Once the solder has flowed, you can quench the piece in a bowl of cool water. After that, you will need to solder the pieces together and then fire coat them again. Once the pieces are soldered together, you can hammer on the ring mandrel with a rawhide mallet to get into the shape of a ring. Finally, you can use a ball-peen hammer to give the ring a hammered texture and then put it in a pickle bath to remove any fire scale and blend marks.

28080.question: How To Install Carpet on Concrete (Basement)
28080.gt: To install carpet on concrete, choose a carpet that is constructed of synthetic products only as natural fibers are often too absorbent. Before you install the carpet, make sure to check the concrete for any moisture issues that need to be addressed. Then, lay tack strips around the perimeter of the room and install your strips of padding. After that, lay your carpet, starting at the center of the room and tightening the carpet with a rented knee kicker as you move toward the walls. Finally, finish with your edges.

The video also shows the person using a tool to trim the excess carpet and ensure a neat finish.
